statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

articles.headline: Thunder wins 14th straight behind Gilgeous-Alexander's 33 points
articles.description: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points, stretching his 20-point streak to 95 straight games, and the Thunder stomped the Mavericks 132-111 for their 14th straight win.

articles.headline: Gilgeous-Alexander's 33 points in 3 quarters power Thunder to 14th straight win
articles.description: — Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 in three quarters, and the Oklahoma City Thunder defeated the Dallas Mavericks 132-111 on Friday night to claim their 14th straight win.

articles.headline: Siakam scores season-high 36 points as Pacers beat struggling Bulls 120-105
articles.description: — Pascal Siakam scored a season-high 36 points, Bennedict Mathurin added 28 and the Indiana Pacers beat the struggling Chicago Bulls 120-105 on Friday night.

images.name: Indiana Pacers vs. Chicago Bulls: Game Highlights
images.caption: Indiana Pacers vs. Chicago Bulls: Game Highlights

articles.headline: Durant reaches 31,000 career points as Rockets dominate Suns
articles.description: — Kevin Durant had 28 points to become the eighth player in NBA history to score 31,000 career points as the Houston Rockets rolled to a 117-98 win over the Phoenix Suns on Friday night.

images.name: Ryan Dunn throws down powerful flush vs. Houston Rockets
